div.sent: A Call to Samuel There was a boy named Samuel.
His mother offered him to serve the Church.
So he served God in the Church.
Eli was the priest of the Church.
He taught Samuel how to serve God and listen to the divine wishes.
He ran up to Eli and said, Did you call me?
Here I am.
Eli replied, I did not call you, go and sleep.
So he went back and fell asleep.
But God called him again, Samuel!
Samuel woke up and went to Eli.
He said, Did you call me?
I am right here.
The priest said, I did not call you, my son, go back and sleep again.
Samuel did not yet know the Lord.
God never talked to him before.
So Samuel went back to sleep again.
God called Samuel for the third time, Samuel!
He again woke up and went to Eli.
In the same way he asked, Did you call me?
Here I am.
Now Eli understood that God Himself called Samuel.
So he said to Samuel, Go back and sleep.
If anyone calls you again, you will say: Speak, my Lord!
Your servant is listening to you.
So Samuel went back to his own place and lay down.
Your servant is listening to You.
It is not in our words alone.
We have to acquire some qualities in order to follow the divine wishes.
We must follow Jesus properly.
And we must study the Holy Bible, meditate deeply and pray to God.
Thus we can know our Lord Jesus and follow his path.
We must carefully listen to the God's call.
But the main objective is one and the same.
It is to love and serve God and His creation.
Many people sacrifised their lives at the call of God.
